bibl.title: Letter from Frank Edmundson to Philip Showalter Hench, July 7, 1941

div1.p: Edmundson informs Hench that he enjoyed the Cornwell painting unveiling and that he hopes Kissinger will recover.

div1.head: Letter from Frank Edmundson to Philip Showalter Hench, July 7, 1941
div1.opener:
FRANK EDMUNDSON, M. D.
SHADYSIDE HOSPITAL
PITTSBURGH
July 7, 1941
Y. F.
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
Your letter concerning Mr. Kissinger awaited my return
to the City a few days ago. I have written to Mrs. Kissinger
and do sincerely hope that this nice old hero of ours is on the
way to recovery.

I desire to take this opportunity of thanking you for
one of the most delightful days I have ever spent. I certainly
enjoyed the unveiling and the luncheon and likewise your very
amusing, interesting, and instructive discourse.

I am very proud to be a member of the American Rheuma-
tism Association. I thotoughly enjoyed the splendid program and
the banquet.

Thanking you for this and many former courtesies and
with all good wishes to you and yours, I am

closer.seg:
P. S. Thanks for the information concerning
Vitamin E - will probably see
you sometime soon in Rochester
and talk the whole “Ball of Wax” over
with you.
